main_point: The professor explains Sign-language classifiers and spatial grammar and how to interpret evidence when measurements can be misleading.
detail1: The professor distinguishes semantic bleaching (a process) from register (a proxy/measurement).
detail2: He suggests testing an asymmetric prediction involving syntax and elicitation.
attitude: Casual but analytical; he warns against over-trusting a neat correlation.
organization_point: He adds a tangent about a lab mishap to show real-world constraints.
connecting_point: The example about controlling for pragmatics shows how bias can flip an apparent pattern.
